intro: Restio debilis var. subulatus, commonly known as the slender restio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, needle-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences that bear tiny, white or pale blue flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Due to its delicate structure and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
